statement: A follow up to yesterday's controversial thread on societal behavior, population immunity and Rt to specifically address issue of what fraction of the population in Florida, Texas and Arizona may have had COVID-19. 1/16 https://twitter.com/trvrb/status/1291860659118804992 …

label: real
statement: I understand the concern. I certainly believe that the "herd immunity" strategy for dealing with COVID-19 is hugely overly costly in terms of health impacts. But it does seem like the strategy is being perhaps unintentionally pursued in parts of the US.

label: real
statement: Thus, I believe the substantial epidemics in Arizona, Florida and Texas will leave enough immunity to assist in keeping COVID-19 controlled. However, this level of immunity is not compatible with a full return to societal behavior as existed before the pandemic. 15/16

label: real
statement: Similarly,  https://covid19-projections.com/us-fl  currently estimates 21% of Florida has had COVID-19 at this point. 11/16 pic.twitter.com/JG6eZMXAs7

label: real
statement: At this point, we think that a substantial fraction of the population of Florida has had COVID-19. If we use a 8:1 ratio of confirmed cases to underlying infections, we'd estimate 510k x 8 = ~4M infections in Florida or roughly 20% of the population. 10/16

label: real
statement: I wanted to discuss the degree to which population immunity may be contributing to curbing #COVID19 in Florida, Arizona and Texas, where recent surges have resulted in substantial epidemics. 1/16

statement: The @CDCgov seroprevalence survey ( https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/cases-updates/commercial-lab-surveys.html …) tests blood samples from different sites in the US for COVID-19 antibodies. With a serosurvey, it's possible to look at the path of the epidemic in a broader fashion than what's available from PCR assay results. 2/13

label: real
statement: With changes in behavior starting in May, we've seen a "surge" in confirmed cases of COVID-19. However, we shouldn't treat the US as a single epidemic. 2/14 https://twitter.com/COVID19Tracking/status/1278809676801470464 …

label: real
statement: It's abundantly clear that societal behavior strongly impacts #COVID19 spread. We saw this early on where social distancing resulted in significant reductions to epidemic spread. label: real
statement: Each age group is separate. In each age group it’s just “what fraction of tests were positive for COVID-19”? Essentially the middle panel divided by the left panel. It shouldn’t add up to 100%.

label: real
statement: With "reopening", we may see this trend in age distribution continue. This should ameliorate some of the health impacts of COVID-19, but will necessarily only go so far. There is no way to completely isolate vulnerable individuals from a widespread epidemic. 10/10

statement: A small follow up to the "long plateau" assessment of the #COVID19 epidemic. When I tweeted this on April 30, we had ~30k daily confirmed cases and ~2000 daily deaths. statement: I'm of course concerned about the protests contributing to epidemic resurgence of #COVID19. They are outside, but close contact and large crowds are risk factors and if they continue day after day with the same group of people you risk amplification. 1/8

statement: Given these probabilities, we can compare hypotheses under equal priors. We get a 9% probability of scenario 1 (false positive in serological assay), 89% probability of scenario 2 (asymptomatic COVID-19 infection) and 2% probability of scenario 3 (COVID-19 infection in Dec). 6/7

label: real
statement: In the third case, we know from @seattleflustudy work that 0 out of 3600 acute respiratory specimens from Seattle area collected in January were COVID-19 positive. A Bayesian estimator for mean prevalence would be 0.03%. 5/7 https://twitter.com/trvrb/status/1249414295042965504 …

label: real
statement: In the second case, we believe that the total attack rate by May 1 in Washington State was ~2% ( https://covid.idmod.org/data/Sustained_reductions_in_transmission_have_led_to_declining_COVID_19_prevalence_in_King_County_WA.pdf …). If we assume that roughly 50% of infections are asymptomatic, this gives a 2% x 50% = ~1% chance of asymptomatic COVID-19 infection. 4/7

label: real
statement:
There are three possibilities:
Scenario 1. False positive in the serological assay.
Scenario 2. A non-COVID infection in December, followed by an asymptomatic COVID-19 infection between Feb and April.
Scenario 3. A bona fide COVID-19 infection in December.
2/7

statement:
A few thoughts on where we stand on #COVID19. 
1. It appears there aren't massive undercounts of cases in China ( https://twitter.com/kakape/status/1232340442215276551 …). This fits as with both my own phylodynamic analyses ( https://twitter.com/trvrb/status/1226739962160115712 …) and those of @erikmvolz ( https://twitter.com/MRC_Outbreak/status/1228652014013427713 …). 1/6

label: real
statement: There are now localized #COVID19 outbreaks in Singapore, Hong Kong, Japan, Korea and Iran. I would have every reason to suspect other seeding events have taken hold elsewhere, but that many surveillance systems haven't yet caught on. 1/4

label: real
statement: #COVID19 was likely circulating in animals prior to Nov-2019. However, every indication is a recent animal-to-human spillover event(s) in Nov/Dec 2019 causing the human epidemic we are dealing with now.

statement: I've written before that #COVID19 has no evidence of genetic engineering and the "bioweapon" theory has no grounds. See, for example  https://twitter.com/trvrb/status/1224207086013149184 …. In this thread I wanted to directly address the theory of escape from lab in Wuhan. 1/21

statement: This virus pangolin/Guangdong/1/2020 groups closely with pangolin/Guangdong/P2S/2019 released yesterday by researchers at the Beijing Institute of Microbiology and Epidemiology and the University of Hong Kong, differing only by ~60 bp and each 93% identical to #COVID19. 2/4  pic.twitter.com/1zqMc04MrS

statement: This new data shows pangolin viruses as a close relative to #COVID19, but not the definitive animal intermediate. For me, this new data suggests pangolins as a plausible intermediate, but more work is required to confirm. 6/8  https://twitter.com/trvrb/status/1229501579696279552 …

statement: .@NIHDirector on the Hill: We are making significant strides at unprecedented speed in developing diagnostics, therapeutics & vaccines for #COVID19. Yet far more work is needed to end this global health crisis. With your support, #NIH is on the case!

label: real
statement: .@NIHDirector on the Hill: A Phase 2 #clinicaltrial of this #COVID19 vaccine candidate began on May 29th. This month, #NIH plans to launch a Phase 3 clinical trial that will seek to enroll 30,000 volunteers, with results expected in a few months.

label: real
statement: .@NIHDirector on the Hill: Still, the ultimate tool we need to end the #COVID19 pandemic is a vaccine. Operation Warp Speed & #ACTIV are working together intensively on vaccine development. A scientific review of more than 50 vaccine candidates has already been conducted. #NIH

label: real
statement: .@NIHDirector on the Hill: But it’s not enough to diagnose this disease. We must treat it, and, as soon as possible, prevent it. label: real
statement: .@NIHDirector on the Hill: Scaling to rapid, routine point-of-care testing would be a major advantage but requires new tech. statement: .@NIHDirector on the Hill: Based on hard work, we now have better means of treating #COVID19 than just a few months ago. Remdesivir and dexamethasone have proven beneficial in rigorous trials and are now standard of care for hospitalized patients. #NIH

label: real
statement: Los síntomas de alarma de #COVID19, son: dolor en el pecho, dificultad para respirar, labios o extremidades moradas (por falta de oxigenación), problemas para platicar con fluidez, cansancio extremo y confusión. pic.twitter.com/KlGFA2up7P

label: real
statement: Personas mayores de 60 años o con enfermedades crónicas deben acudir a valoración médica cuando presenten los primeros síntomas de #COVID19. pic.twitter.com/klgGtKEqXA

label: real
statement: Ocho de cada diez personas presentan síntomas leves de #COVID19; sin embargo, la enfermedad puede empeorar en horas, si sientes que te falta la respiración, no esperes, solicita atención médica de inmediato.  pic.twitter.com/ZqVx8WuOzr

सार्वजनिक स्थानों पर थूकने से #COVID19 के संक्रमण का खतरा बढ़ता है। हमारा कर्तव्य है कि हम ख़ुद को और अपने आसपास लोगों को सुरक्षित रखें। ज़िम्मेदार बनें, सुरक्षित रहें। थूकना वर्जित, स्वास्थ्य अर्जित। 

#BadalkarApnaVyavaharKareinCoronaParVaar pic.twitter.com/TVmw4BfphB

label: real
statement:
#IndiaFightsCorona

आपका अपना हाथ आपको  #COVID19 से लड़ने का संदेश दे रहा है। इस जानकारी को साझा करें और अपनी सुरक्षा के लिए हमारी मदद करें।

 #BadalkarApnaVyavaharKareinCoronaParVaar #TogetherAgainstCovid19 #HealthForAll #SwasthaBharat #CoronaOutbreak #Unlock2 pic.twitter.com/fkJezJ4q9Q

label: real
statement:
#IndiaFightsCorona
#COVID19 के संक्रमण से स्वस्थ हुए लोगों के साथ भेदभाव ना करें। इनको विजेता के रूप में अपनाएं। 

#TogetherAgainstCovid19 #HealthForAll #SwasthaBharat #CoronaOutbreak
@PMOIndia @drharshvardhan @AshwiniKChoubey @PIB_India @CovidIndiaSeva @COVIDNewsByMIB pic.twitter.com/ydqAYudgfi

label: real
statement:
#IndiaFightsCorona

हर समय #COVID19 से जुड़े उचित व्यवहार का पालन करें और ख़ुद को व दूसरों को सुरक्षित रखें। बदलकर अपना व्यवहार, करें कोरोना पर वार।

 #TogetherAgainstCovid19 #HealthForAll #SwasthaBharat #CoronaOutbreak #Unlock2 pic.twitter.com/SziguFNDV4

label: real
statement:
#IndiaFightsCorona
#COVID19 के संक्रमण से बचाव के लिए अपना मास्क हमेशा पहनकर रखें और दूसरों से कम से कम दो गज की दूरी बनाकर रखें। एक जागरूक नागरिक बनें। बदलकर अपना व्यवहार, करें कोरोना पर वार।

#TogetherAgainstCovid19
@PMOIndia @drharshvardhan @AshwiniKChoubey @PIB_India pic.twitter.com/S188DBOD0j

label: real
statement:
#IndiaFightsCorona

आइये, हम #COVID19 के खिलाफ इस लड़ाई में एक-दूसरे का सहयोग करें। 

#TogetherAgainstCovid19 #SwasthaBharat #CoronaOutbreak #HealthForAll #Unlock2 pic.twitter.com/Fs8Dfv6s0O

label: real
statement:
#IndiaFightsCorona

आइये, अपने दैनिक जीवन में इन नियमों को शामिल करें। #COVID19 के संक्रमण से बचाव के लिये इन दिशा-निर्देशों का पालन करें और खुद को एवं अपने प्रियजनों को सुरक्षित रखें। बदलकर अपना व्यवहार, करें कोरोना पर वार। 

#TogetherAgainstCovid19 #CoronaOutbreak #Unlock2 pic.twitter.com/EoKCB8Itdm

label: real
statement:
#IndiaFightsCorona
एक दूसरे से बातें करते समय भी मास्क पहने रहें। #COVID19 के संक्रमण से खुद को और दूसरों को सुरक्षित रखें। 
बदलकर अपना व्यवहार, करें कोरोना पर वार। #TogetherAgainstCovid19 #SwasthaBharat #CoronaOutbreak
#Unlock2 pic.twitter.com/eCWtne0f2Y

label: real
statement:
#NationalDoctorsDay
#COVID19 के खिलाफ इस लड़ाई में अग्रिम पंक्ति में खड़े सभी डॉक्टरों का बहुत-बहुत धन्यवाद। आपकी कड़ी मेहनत, समर्पण और साहस काबिले तारीफ है। 

#SwasthaBharat #HealthForAll pic.twitter.com/nceViI8olh

label: real
statement:
#IndiaFightsCorona
#COVID19 के संक्रमण से ख़ुद को सुरक्षित रखने के लिए बुनियादी सुरक्षात्मक उपायों का पालन करें। नियमित रुप से हाथ धोएं, मास्क पहनें और दूसरों से उचित दूरी बनाकर रखें। बदलकर अपना व्यवहार, करें कोरोना पर वार। 

#TogetherAgainstCovid19 #CoronaOutbreak pic.twitter.com/oX3WZUWzu6

label: real
statement:
#COVID19 के संक्रमण की तरह यदि #SwineFlu का भी सही समय पर पता चल जाए तो इससे बचा जा सकता है। अगर आपको #H1N1 वायरस के संक्रमण का कोई भी लक्षण महसूस हो, तो अपने डॉक्टर से तुरन्त सलाह लें।
जानकारी दें, सतर्क रहें।

 #SwasthaBharat #HealthForAll pic.twitter.com/vNqqhe54za

label: real
statement:
#IndiaFightsCorona

statement:

आइये, इस कठिन समय में एक जुट होकर एक-दूसरे का सहयोग करें। #COVID19 को लेकर फैले तिरस्कार की भावना को खत्म करें। तिरस्कार नहीं, स्वीकार करें। 

#HealthForAll #CoronaOutbreak #SwasthaBharat #Lockdown3 #TiraskarNahiTilakKarein pic.twitter.com/neo8RIpMEn

statement:

हमें मिलकर #COVID19 से लड़ना है। 

#CoronaOutbreak #SwasthaBharat #HealthForAll #Lockdown2 pic.twitter.com/sWYMIDhV8r

label: real
statement:
#IndiaFightsCorona:

#COVID19 के दाग को खत्म करें और ख़ुद को सुरक्षित रखने के लिए सावधानी बरतें। 
COVID-19 के खिलाफ हमें मिलकर लड़ना है।

#CoronaOutbreak #SwasthaBharat #HealthForAll #Lockdown2 pic.twitter.com/4qt55ehTcT

label: real
statement:
#IndiaFightsCorona:

रितु ने घर पर रहने और एक-दूसरे से उचित दूरी बनाए रखने को महत्व दिया है। वह #COVID19 के खिलाफ इस लड़ाई में अपना योगदान दे रही है। अपनी और अपने प्रियजनों की सुरक्षा का ख्याल रखती है। आप भी रितु की तरह बनें। हमें मिलकर  #COVID19 से लड़ना है। 

#Lockdown2 pic.twitter.com/3DurgG4t4M

label: real
statement:
#IndiaFightsCorona:

अपनी सुरक्षा के लिए हमारी मदद करें।

#CoronaOutbreak #SwasthaBharat #HealthForAll #Lockdown2 pic.twitter.com/96GFuq0siK

statement: We can plot out the general relationship between Rt (as red vs blue) vs population immunity (on the x-axis) vs social connectivity (on the y-axis). label: real
statement: Here, we expect Rt will equal R0 ⨉ fraction of the population susceptible ⨉ relative social connectivity. If R0 is 2.5 and social connectivity is 56% of normal then realized Rt will be 1.4. In this case, the herd immune threshold would be 29%. 8/16 pic.twitter.com/AzMDXbIGxS

statement: However, societal behavior has dramatically reduced Rt through social distancing, mask wearing, etc... The surge in Florida had Rt of only ~1.4 at its peak. Because of this reduction in transmission through social means, we don't need as much immunity to impact spread. 7/16

statement: If we take the simplest model of population immunity, we expect Rt will equal R0 ⨉ fraction of the population susceptible. This is where the usual "herd immunity threshold" comes in. statement: Exactly. WHO is often just standards setting body, where governments agree on health policy issues, then local governments and NGOs actually do the work. In the GISRS network discussed above, the labs are local ministries of health and the like, but just coordinated through WHO.

label: real
statement: The GISRS network is an amazing public health achievement. statement: In 1927(!), Kermack and McKendrick derived the total proportion of the population expected to be infected in the course of an epidemic in a simple SIR model as the attached equation. statement: Coronaviruses have less error-prone replication than flu at the per base level, but because they have a longer genome, the genomic rate of mutation is similar to flu. statement: Mutations can occur that change the proteins made by the virus and other mutations can occur that change the genome but not the proteins. This is due to the degeneracy of the genetic code ( https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Genetic_code#Degeneracy …). 9/13

statement: What's very tricky is that we can't know without doing experiments if one genetic variant behaves differently than another, especially when there's only a small handful of genetic changes between them. 8/13

statement: "Strain" is unfortunately an overloaded scientific term. In many circumstances every unique viral genome will be counted as a separate strain. If we use this criteria then we've seen 1150 "strains" out of 2243 #SARSCoV2 genomes currently up at  https://nextstrain.org/ncov . 3/13

statement: Together, I believe these (and other case-based) strategies can bring down the epidemic. This is the Apollo program of our times. Let's get to it. 19/19

label: real
statement: Individuals who have serological evidence of recovery and are no longer shedding virus can fully return to the workforce and keep society functioning (especially important for those at the clinical front lines). 18/19

label: real
statement: A third, supporting, strategy: as the epidemic proceeds get serological assays run on as many people as possible to systematically identify individuals who have recovered and are highly likely to possess immunity. 17/19

label: real
statement: This strategy targets testing capacity at most likely cases and serves to detect exposure events early, when isolation is most valuable. This cell phone location based approach is outlined carefully here:  https://github.com/BDI-pathogens/covid-19_instant_tracing …. 16/19

label: real
statement: The second, related, strategy is using cell phone location data combined with data on known positive cases to alert possible exposures to self isolate and get tested. Figure from @ChristoPhraser and colleagues who've considered this in detail. 15/19 pic.twitter.com/iAllsqE52E

label: real
statement: This rollout of testing could be achieved through at home delivery of swabs with centralized lab-based processing combined with drive-through testing facilities. There are logistics involved in getting a result quickly, but it's really just logistics, which can be solved. 14/19

label: real
statement: This strategy of massive testing has been a cornerstone in South Korea's response ( https://www.sciencemag.org/news/2020/03/coronavirus-cases-have-dropped-sharply-south-korea-whats-secret-its-success …) and we're now seeing their epidemic brought under control without the stringent policies put in place elsewhere. Case counts in South Korea via @covid2019app. 13/19 pic.twitter.com/svdcKUkI9O

label: real
statement: These transmission routes can be reduced by a huge rollout of testing capacity. If someone can be tested early in their illness before they show symptoms, they could effectively self isolate and reduce onward transmission compared to isolation when symptoms develop. 12/19

label: real
statement: We also believe that a significant amount of transmission may occur in the window before symptoms develop (evidence from viral load dynamics  https://www.nejm.org/doi/full/10.1056/NEJMc2001737 …, evidence from serial intervals  https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/32145466 ). 11/19

label: real
statement: The first strategy revolves around a massive rollout of testing capacity. We believe that a significant proportion of epidemic transmission is due to mild and maybe even asymptomatic infections ( https://science.sciencemag.org/content/early/2020/03/13/science.abb3221 …). 10/19

label: real
statement: There are two main case-based strategies that I see here, both related, as well as a supporting serological strategy. 9/19

statement: However, I'm not quite that pessimistic. Although I agree that basic mitigation efforts won't stop the epidemic, I have hope that we can solve this thing by doing traditional shoe leather epidemiology of case finding and isolation, but at scale, using modern technology. 8/19

statement: I’m not making policy judgements on cost / benefit of restricting travel. Here I’m just trying to get a handle on what’s driving transmission so the evidence base exists to inform policy decisions made by others.

statement: I don't know exactly how to square the finding of a large community cluster in Washington State with these 4 apparently recently introduced viruses in other states. My strong suspicion is that more sequencing will reveal growing community clusters elsewhere in the US as well. 8/8

label: real
statement: San Diego County has a virus that appears to be a recent introduction from Europe, and besides the two Grand Princess-associated cases, the remaining genome from Minnesota also appears to be a recent European import clustering closely with viruses sampled in the Netherlands. 7/8

label: real
statement: Other states have fewer recently sequenced viruses. NY has two, one with direct travel history to Iran (and which has a genome consistent with this travel history) and another that appears to be a recent travel introduction from Europe. 6/8 pic.twitter.com/YvTs58TcfC

label: real
statement: Thus, for WA state new introductions from outside the US appear to be driving many fewer new infections than local transmission. 5/8

label: real
statement: The other four viruses appear as one-off introductions of either immediate travel cases, or as recent steps in a newly arrived transmission chain. Given genetic proximity, these appear to be related to viruses from Europe and Iran. 4/8 pic.twitter.com/PJdzoDR8ee

label: real
statement: Thanks to sequencing by @UWVirology, @CDCgov and @seattleflustudy we have genomes for 39 viruses sampled from WA. Importantly 35 of these 39 viruses (90%) fall into a single genetic cluster indicating a single ~Jan introduction from China and subsequent local spread. 3/8 pic.twitter.com/LrEhdo5Sol

statement: The seeming sudden appearance of outbreaks across the US are not due to a sudden influx of cases. Instead, transmission chains have been percolating for 4-8 weeks now and we're just now starting to see exponential growth pick up steam. 5/13

statement: I believe that a 5-6 day doubling is an accurate model for growth, so that sparks that landed in mid-Jan may have grown to ~2000 infections at this point and sparks that arrived in mid-Feb may have grown to ~50 infections at this point. 4/13

✔️ Coche, taxi o VTC: una persona por fila de asiento

✔️ Bus, metro o cernanías: usa mascarilla

❌ Existe riesgo para ti o para los demás.

statement:
🎭🎵En las zonas con transmisión comunitaria significativa se suspenden las actividades colectivas celebradas en espacios cerrados y que impliquen a más de 1.000 personas. Si tienen un aforo menor al millar, podrán celebrarse si únicamente se cubre un tercio del aforo. 
#COVID19 pic.twitter.com/ip5rC0uSoI

label: real
real
statement:
Para el conjunto de todo el territorio español:

🧓Fomentar el cuidado domiciliario de los mayores

🩺Personas con enfermedades crónicas o pluripatologías: deben limitar sus salidas

#COVID19  pic.twitter.com/Id3Xaa15m3

label: real
statement:
👩‍💻En las zonas con transmisión comunitaria significativa, @sanidadgob y CCAA recomiendan que se adopten siempre que sea posible medidas de teletrabajo, flexibilización de horarios y reuniones no presenciales.
#COVID19  pic.twitter.com/ffGRvWAKlJ

label: real
statement:
"Son medidas que implican una alteración de la actividad ordinaria de las familias. Por eso, apelo a la comprensión de la ciudadanía, son medidas que consideramos necesarias en estos territorios", @salvadorilla
#COVID19  pic.twitter.com/5QVtldhWly

label: real
statement:
🚸"Hemos acordado con las CCAA que en las zonas de transmisión comunitaria significativa se procederá a la suspensión de las clases y de las actividades extraescolares", @salvadorilla 

Actualmente estas zonas son: Comunidad de Madrid, Vitoria y Labastida" #COVID19  pic.twitter.com/Yl8Pv1cYUU

label: real
statement:
🗞️El Consejo Interterritorial del SNS acuerda medidas concretas para zonas con transmisión comunitaria significativa de #COVID19

statement:
"Llegaron sanos y se van del hospital sanos”, ha subrayado la Dra. García Rosado.

#COVID19 pic.twitter.com/wyLnK0LU3M

label: real
statement:
La jefa del Servicio de Medicina Preventiva del Hospital Gómez Ulla, María Vicenta García, ha recordado que desde que conocieron el traslado de estas personas al centro "nos pusimos a trabajar y seleccionamos al personal aunque sabíamos que se trataba de personas sanas"
#COVID19 pic.twitter.com/K73oAyUhGO

label: real
statement:
"Por tanto –ha añadido Simón- no tenemos #coronavirus
 y no hay riesgo de infectarse y, mucho menos, de las personas a las que hoy se les ha dado el alta porque
 hemos comprobado que no tienen el virus".

#COVID19 pic.twitter.com/yEemLFLdb8

label: real
statement:
🗣️ Fernando Simón en rueda de prensa: 

Las 21 personas que estaban en cuarentena en el Hospital Gómez Ulla de @Defensagob, repatriadas desde Wuhan, han terminado su periodo de vigilancia y han salido del hospital.

No ha habido ninguna incidencia. 

#Coronavirus #COVID19  pic.twitter.com/67EbVFNWLP
